channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for KY
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for KY

item.title: Report X-2024021371
item.description:
Report X-2024021371

Identified by scraper @ 2024-03-04T15:11:50+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-02-08
  • City: INDEPENDENCE
  • State: KY
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package was brought to QA because it was leaking, once it was inspected it was found that the jerrican inside the package was leaking from the spout and it was a suspected undeclared hazmat so it was taken back to the hazmat cage for further processing. DescribePack: Cap on jerrican came loose during transit. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: An attempt was made to tighten cap on jerrican, but it would not tighten. Package was kept in an upright position in a lined tote.

item.title: Report X-2024021213
item.description:
Report X-2024021213

Identified by scraper @ 2024-03-04T15:11:50+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-02-14
  • City: INDEPENDENCE
  • State: KY
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package came down the QAT slide with a wet spot on it. It was given to QA for inspection. Package was put into a lined tote immediately and was inspected. DescribePack: When package was inspected it was found that one bottle had a loose cap that allowed internal leakage. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Cap was tightened and package was kept upright in a lined tote.

  • Description: SequenceEvent: The manager noticed the outer packaging wet and called QA. We secured the hazmat in a lined red tote, tightened the caps. Spill pads were used to clean up the floor, DescribePack: Cap became loose DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Cap was tightened and package was placed in a lined red tote.

item.title: Report X-2024020927
item.description:
Report X-2024020927

Identified by scraper @ 2024-02-29T18:14:06+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-02-05
  • City: INDEPENDENCE
  • State: KY
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Hazmat was placed on its side causing a cap to became loose and leak. Once manager notified QA we cleaned up the soiled product with absorbent pads. We secured the package and soiled clean up materials in a lined red tote DescribePack: Cap became loose DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Cap was tightened and hazmat was placed in a lined red tote.

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: While unloading the package began to leak. They sat it down and called QA. We swept up the soiled hazardous materials and secured them and they package in a lined red tote. DescribePack: Cap on 5 gallon bucket became loose DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Package was placed in a lined red tote.

  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package was found leaking on IC belt, QA was called to pick it up, package was put into a lined tote and spill pad was used to clean off IC belt. DescribePack: Cap came loose during handling causing internal leakage. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Package was put into a lined tote in an upright position and caps were tightened.

item.title: Report X-2024020805
item.description:
Report X-2024020805

Identified by scraper @ 2024-02-28T18:14:16+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-01-29
  • City: LEXINGTON
  • State: KY
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: X-2024020805: SequenceEvent: driver states packages were damaged prior to being loaded onto vehicle due to mishandling during the inbound sort. discovered by VSA at approximately 4:30PM promptly sectioned off area and proceeded begin damaged HazMat procedures. DescribePack: a pin sized hole on the bottom of the plastic container approximately ~1 centimeter in diameter DurationRel: 7 and MitigateEffect: quarantined immediate area promptly putting leaking packages into HazMat plastic lined salvage drums. X-2024020807: SequenceEvent: Driver states package was damaged before loading onto vehicle. package got damaged due to mishandling during the inbound sort. DescribePack: package leaking contents from pin sized hole in bottom of the container approximately ~1 centimeter in diameter. DurationRel: 7 and MitigateEffect: quarantined immediate area and put Amphomag onto spill area to neutralize acidic substances.

item.title: Report X-2024020838
item.description:
Report X-2024020838

Identified by scraper @ 2024-02-28T18:14:16+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-01-31
  • City: INDEPENDENCE
  • State: KY
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Trailer door was not properly closed allowing package to fall out and for bottle inside to leak. Package was brought to QA after proper procedure for spill was followed by managers. DescribePack: Side of bottle was cracked allowing all of its contents to leak out. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Package was put into a lined tote once it was in QA's possession.

item.title: Report X-2024020836
item.description:
Report X-2024020836

Identified by scraper @ 2024-02-28T18:14:16+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-01-31
  • City: INDEPENDENCE
  • State: KY
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: QA was called to pick up a leaking hazmat on a newly opened trailer. Once QA arrived to the spill it was noted that the leaking hazmat was crushed due to being loaded in properly. IC's had crushed the package and allowed it to leak and damage another hazmat. Leaking hazmat was put into a lined tote, and non leaking hazmat was put into another tote. Neutralizer was used on leaked product. DescribePack: Package was crushed causing damage to two bottles causing leakage. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Package was put in to a lined tote in an upright position.
